table.name: PackageCompanyInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[PackageCompanyInd] AS select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY co.CompanyId ASC) AS RowId, co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName, count(*) as NumPackages from dbo.Package pa inner join dbo.Project pr on pa.ProjectId = pr.ProjectId inner join dbo.Company co on pr.CompanyId = co.CompanyId group by co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName

table.name: PackageCompanyStatusInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[PackageCompanyStatusInd] AS select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY co.CompanyId ASC) AS RowId, psd.LanguageId, co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName, psd.PackageStatusName, count(*) as NumPackages from dbo.Package pa inner join dbo.PackageStatus ps on pa.PackageStatusId = ps.PackageStatusId inner join dbo.PackageStatusDet psd on pa.PackageStatusId = psd.PackageStatusId inner join dbo.Project pr on pa.ProjectId = pr.ProjectId inner join dbo.Company co on pr.CompanyId = co.CompanyId group by psd.LanguageId, co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName, psd.PackageStatusName

table.name: PackageCompanyTypeInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[PackageCompanyTypeInd] AS select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY co.CompanyId ASC) AS RowId, co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName, pt.PackageTypeName, count(*) as NumPackages from dbo.Package pa inner join dbo.PackageType pt on pa.PackageTypeId = pt.PackageTypeId inner join dbo.Project pr on pa.ProjectId = pr.ProjectId inner join dbo.Company co on pr.CompanyId = co.CompanyId group by co.CompanyId,co.CompanyName, pt.PackageTypeName

table.name: PackageGlobalStatusInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[PackageGlobalStatusInd] AS select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY psd.PackageStatusName ASC) AS RowId, psd.LanguageId, psd.PackageStatusName, count(*) as NumPackages from dbo.Package pa inner join dbo.PackageStatus ps on pa.PackageStatusId = ps.PackageStatusId inner join dbo.PackageStatusDet psd on pa.PackageStatusId = psd.PackageStatusId group by psd.LanguageId, psd.PackageStatusName

table.name: PackageGlobalTypeInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[PackageGlobalTypeInd] AS select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY pt.PackageTypeName ASC) AS RowId, pt.PackageTypeName, count(*) as NumPackages from dbo.Package pa inner join dbo.PackageType pt on pa.PackageTypeId = pt.PackageTypeId group by pt.PackageTypeName

table.name: ProjectCompanyStateInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[ProjectCompanyStateInd] AS with cte (CompanyId, CompanyName, Opened, Closed) as ( select CompanyId, CompanyName , [0] as opened,[1] as closed from ( select co.CompanyId, co.CompanyName, 1 as numprojects, pj.Closed from dbo.Project pj inner join dbo.Company co on pj.CompanyId = co.CompanyId ) as origen PIVOT (count(numprojects) for closed in ([0],[1])) as PivotTable ) select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY CompanyId ASC) AS RowId, CompanyId, CompanyName, Opened, Closed ,opened + closed as Total from cte c

table.name: ProjectGlobalStateInd
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW [dbo].[ProjectGlobalStateInd] AS with cte ( Opened, Closed) as ( select [0] as opened,[1] as closed from ( select 1 as numprojects, pj.Closed from dbo.Project pj ) as origen PIVOT (count(numprojects) for closed in ([0],[1])) as PivotTable ) select ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY Opened ASC) AS RowId, Opened, Closed ,opened + closed as Total from cte c

routine.name: ContadoresTablasSeq
fn_diagramobjects
routine.definition:
CREATE FUNCTION dbo.fn_diagramobjects() RETURNS int WITH EXECUTE AS N'dbo' AS BEGIN declare @id_upgraddiagrams int declare @id_sysdiagrams int declare @id_helpdiagrams int declare @id_helpdiagramdefinition int declare @id_creatediagram int declare @id_renamediagram int declare @id_alterdiagram int declare @id_dropdiagram int declare @InstalledObjects int
select @InstalledObjects = 0
select @id_upgraddiagrams = object_id(N'dbo.sp_upgraddiagrams'), @id_sysdiagrams = object_id(N'dbo.sysdiagrams'), @id_helpdiagrams = object_id(N'dbo.sp_helpdiagrams'), @id_helpdiagramdefinition = object_id(N'dbo.sp_helpdiagramdefinition'), @id_creatediagram = object_id(N'dbo.sp_creatediagram'), @id_renamediagram = object_id(N'dbo.sp_renamediagram'), @id_alterdiagram = object_id(N'dbo.sp_alterdiagram'), @id_dropdiagram = object_id(N'dbo.sp_dropdiagram')
if @id_upgraddiagrams is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 1 if @id_sysdiagrams is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 2 if @id_helpdiagrams is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 4 if @id_helpdiagramdefinition is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 8 if @id_creatediagram is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 16 if @id_renamediagram is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 32 if @id_alterdiagram is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 64 if @id_dropdiagram is not null select @InstalledObjects = @InstalledObjects + 128
return @InstalledObjects END

routine.name: sp_alterdiagram
sp_creatediagram
sp_dropdiagram
sp_helpdiagramdefinition
sp_helpdiagrams
routine.definition: CREATE PROCEDURE dbo.sp_helpdiagrams ( @diagramname sysname = NULL, @owner_id int = NULL ) WITH EXECUTE AS N'dbo' AS BEGIN DECLARE @user sysname DECLARE @dboLogin bit EXECUTE AS CALLER; SET @user = USER_NAME(); SET @dboLogin = CONVERT(bit,IS_MEMBER('db_owner')); REVERT; SELECT [Database] = DB_NAME(), [Name] = name, [ID] = diagram_id, [Owner] = USER_NAME(principal_id), [OwnerID] = principal_id FROM sysdiagrams WHERE (@dboLogin = 1 OR USER_NAME(principal_id) = @user) AND (@diagramname IS NULL OR name = @diagramname) AND (@owner_id IS NULL OR principal_id = @owner_id) ORDER BY 4, 5, 1 END

routine.name: sp_renamediagram
sp_upgraddiagrams
